veterinaryInsights.text:
Lafeber will be closed on Thursday, November 27th and Friday, November 28th 2025. We will return on Monday, December 1st.
Caring and working for the health of animals
Lafeber Company was built by a father-son team of veterinarians with a shared love of animals and a special passion for birds. Our manufacturing facility has always been located on the Lafeber family farmland, and all of our products are mixed, formed, and packaged under one roof.
Learn more about us

Association of
                                                                Exotic Mammal Veterinarians

sentences:
Association of
                                                                Exotic Mammal Veterinarians

veterinaryInsights.text: AEMV serves as a crucial resource for veterinarians and pet owners, offering them access to the latest research, clinical techniques, and professional development opportunities.

sentences: AEMV serves as a crucial resource for veterinarians and pet owners, offering them access to the latest research, clinical techniques, and professional development opportunities

veterinaryInsights.text: Your exotic mammal has unique medical needs, from diet to disease management, which demands the expertise of a veterinarian who is trained in the care of these species. Use the Find a Vet feature to search for a trusted veterinarian near you who has a specific interest in exotic mammal health.

sentences: Your exotic mammal has unique medical needs, from diet to disease management, which demands the expertise of a veterinarian who is trained in the care of these species
Use the Find a Vet feature to search for a trusted veterinarian near you who has a specific interest in exotic mammal health

veterinaryInsights.text: Joining the Association of Exotic Mammal Veterinarians is essential for any veterinarian or veterinary technician who is committed to providing the best possible care for exotic mammal pets. Membership offers unparalleled access to a wealth of resources, including veterinary research and communications. Additionally, being part of this community connects veterinarians and veterinary technologists with a network of experts and peers who share a passion for advancing the field.

sentences: Joining the Association of Exotic Mammal Veterinarians is essential for any veterinarian or veterinary technician who is committed to providing the best possible care for exotic mammal pets
Membership offers unparalleled access to a wealth of resources, including veterinary research and communications
Additionally, being part of this community connects veterinarians and veterinary technologists with a network of experts and peers who share a passion for advancing the field

veterinaryInsights.text: You will have access to exotic mammal care and disease handouts for both clients and veterinarians, continuing education opportunities around the globe, and lectures and proceedings from previous conferences as well as a community of experts dedicated to the care of exotic mammals.

sentences: You will have access to exotic mammal care and disease handouts for both clients and veterinarians, continuing education opportunities around the globe, and lectures and proceedings from previous conferences as well as a community of experts dedicated to the care of exotic mammals

veterinaryInsights.text: Connect with other exotic mammal veterinarians, and ask questions about care, nutrition, and more in our exclusive members-only Facebook page.

sentences: Connect with other exotic mammal veterinarians, and ask questions about care, nutrition, and more in our exclusive members-only Facebook page

veterinaryInsights.text: Stay at the forefront of exotic mammal care with comprehensive continuing education programs, designed to enhance your expertise and keep you updated on the latest veterinary advancements.

sentences: Stay at the forefront of exotic mammal care with comprehensive continuing education programs, designed to enhance your expertise and keep you updated on the latest veterinary advancements

veterinaryInsights.text: "I initially joined the AEMV during my first year after graduating in order to step my toes into the world of exotic medicine. I had just adopted my first rabbit as an adult and wanted to make sure I had access to the most up-to-date information on caring for him as a pet owner and new doctor. As I have grown and developed as a doctor, AEMV has been there to provide access to continuing education, the Journal for Exotic Pet Medicine, and access to member forums that have helped me gain my footing as an exotic mammal veterinarian. I would highly recommend membership to anyone interested in stepping into the exotics world and to veterinarians with years of experience."

				We Know Bunnies.
			
						
	


	
		
	The authors and bunny educators you have trusted for over 30 years have come together to create a new rabbit.org website. We're honored to be the stewards of this trusted rabbit resource.

	


	
		
	Please join us in our quest to end the suffering, abuse, and exploitation of all rabbits through education and advocacy.

				Shelters & Rescuers

Events and activities to kick-start your curiosity      
      

Family-friendly programs, 21+ evenings, and DIY science for all
    
                
              
      
THURSDAYS | 6-10 P.M. | 21+
    
          
        NightLife      
      

Wonder what our animals get up to once the sun goes down? Find out at the Academy's weekly event that illuminates the unusual intersection of art and science.

 Brighten Up
    
                
              
      
NOW BOOKING
    
          
        Family sleepovers      
      

Treat your family to an unforgettable overnight at the museum. Includes an action-packed evening, yummy snacks, next-day admission, parking, and more.Dream On1  


  
    
    
          
        Exhibits and shows for explorers of all ages      
      

See what's on
    
                
              
      

    
                
      
      
OPEN DAILY
    
          
        See the BigPicture      
      

Nature is always ready for its close-up. Be amazed by award-winning images of captivating creatures and luscious landscapes in this year's BigPicture exhibition.Zoom In
    
                
              
      
OPEN DAILY
    
          
        Twilight Zone      
      

Candy colors. Ingenious adaptations. Extreme conditions. Meet the unusual animals of deep reefs—including some species that have yet to be described.Go Deep1

healthRecommendations.text: Other VMTH services to provide nutritional recommendations and feeding plans for their patients

preparationMethods.text: Other VMTH services to provide nutritional recommendations and feeding plans for their patients
Evaluation and formulation of computer-generated, home-prepared therapeutic diets

veterinaryInsights.text: Welcome to the Nutrition Service at the UC Davis Veterinary Medical Teaching Hospital

sentences: Welcome to the Nutrition Service at the UC Davis Veterinary Medical Teaching Hospital

veterinaryInsights.text: The clinical scope of the Nutrition Support Service includes:

sentences: The clinical scope of the Nutrition Support Service includes:

veterinaryInsights.text:
Contact
  
    Nutrition ServiceTelephone(530) 752-7892 (service)(530) 752-1393 (hospital)Email: nssvetmed@ucdavis.eduLocationUC Davis Health Science DistrictVMTH1 Garrod DriveDavis, California 95616Discover the latest nutrition clinical trials at UC DavisPlease note that we cannot provide any advice for a specific patient unless you are a veterinarian or a current patient of the Nutrition Service. If you have an urgent issue that requires prompt attention, or if your pet is a current patient, please call the service directly to be connected to the Nutrition Service technician.
  

Welcome to the Nutrition Service at the UC Davis Veterinary Medical Teaching HospitalThe service provides nutritional consultations for the following:Pet owners who wish to consult a nutritionistOther VMTH services to provide nutritional recommendations and feeding plans for their patientsVeterinarians outside of UC DavisThe clinical scope of the Nutrition Support Service includes:Commercial diet recommendationsCritical care nutritionCustomized weight loss programsNutritional consultation for metabolic diseasesEvaluation and formulation of computer-generated, home-prepared therapeutic dietsAbout The ServiceClients within traveling distance to UC Davis can arrange a direct appointment with the Nutrition Service. Appointments are especially beneficial for patients in which traditional nutritional approaches have proven unsuccessful or for clients with a special interest in nutrition.The service also conducts remote consultations through primary veterinarians. Veterinarians can contact the Nutrition Service by telephone, and many of our services are provided via telephone, email, videoconference, or fax.Direct appointmentsIn order to strive for the most precise recommendations with positive outcomes, a minimal work-up of the patient’s health status must be performed prior to an appointment with the Nutrition Service. This generally includes a physical examination, complete blood count and biochemical panel including a T4, and may also include imaging, urinalysis, and biopsies depending upon the patient’s condition. Contact the service for more information.Remote consultationsUnfortunately, unless a relationship has been established between the client and the Nutrition Service clinicians with a direct appointment, advice regarding disease management for specific pets cannot be provided directly to clients. Consults must be initiated by the primary care veterinarian who has the most current knowledge of the patient. A summarized medical history and detailed diet history, in addition to recent laboratory results are usually required prior to the initiation of a consultation. Client communication for such cases is handled by the primary care veterinarian.Our Customized ApproachAll cases undergo extensive medical record review, as well as evaluation of the dietary history including treats and supplements. The process can be quite involved, as strategies and products are evaluated for both safety and efficacy in light of clinical experience, as well as through research including scientific literature review. This preliminary assessment is followed by quantitative computer analysis of data. This process ensures the development of a comprehensive and truly customized nutritional management plan.Frequently Asked Questions (pdf)The Nutrition Service Provides:Home-prepared recipe formulationsSpecialized computer software is used to design customized recipes that meet the needs of individual patients using common human foods. This process involves evaluation of the medical history of individual patients, as well as the application of knowledge, experience and a large amount of information from a variety of sources.Download "What will my recipe look like" (pdf) Client home-prepared recipe evaluationsRecipes are analyzed and adjusted to ensure that they are balanced and appropriate for the individual patient.Nutritional supplement evaluationsSupplements are reviewed for evidence of published data supporting safety and efficacy of the product for the species of interest and the intended use.Weight loss plansCustomized diet programs to achieve controlled weight loss are critical to minimize hunger and avoid muscle loss.Nutritional counselingFeeding strategies for disease prevention, management and/or treatment for specific patients are discussed with consulting veterinarians and during direct appointments.Critical care nutritional supportCustomized formulations and feeding guidelines for enteral support (tube feeding) as well as for parenteral (intravenous) administration are available. The Nutrition Service also provides patient monitoring guidelines to consulting veterinarians.Commercial food recommendationsThe Nutrition Service provides assistance in selecting appropriate commercially available food options for patients in various life stages and those with specific diseases.What is a Veterinary Nutritionist?The American College of Veterinary Internal Medicine now includes Nutrition as its sixth specialty (until 2021, and since 1988, there was a separate American College of Veterinary Nutrition). The specialty comprises veterinarians who have undergone advanced clinical and research training in the field of nutrition. Many have a graduate degree in nutrition in addition to their veterinary medical degree. All have completed extensive residency training which involves intensive clinical, teaching, and research activities. Trainees are required to pass written examinations in order to obtain board certification. These specialists are uniquely trained in the nutritional management of both healthy animals and those with one or more diseases. Members of this specialty college add the suffix “Diplomate ACVIM (Nutrition)” and are Board Certified Veterinary Nutritionists®. The UC Davis School of Veterinary Medicine is fortunate to be supported by several boarded nutritionists and veterinarians training for the specialty. The large group of veterinarians enables the Nutrition Service to have unique programs such as a veterinary student rotation, an outside consulting service for practicing veterinarians worldwide, and an active receiving service for referred cases from general practitioners and specialists in other fields.Diet History Form (doc)Nutrition Consult Request Form (doc)Treat Guidelines for Dogs (pdf)Faculty

Contact
  
    Nutrition ServiceTelephone(530) 752-7892 (service)(530) 752-1393 (hospital)Email: nssvetmed@ucdavis

eduLocationUC Davis Health Science DistrictVMTH1 Garrod DriveDavis, California 95616Discover the latest nutrition clinical trials at UC DavisPlease note that we cannot provide any advice for a specific patient unless you are a veterinarian or a current patient of the Nutrition Service
If you have an urgent issue that requires prompt attention, or if your pet is a current patient, please call the service directly to be connected to the Nutrition Service technician

Welcome to the Nutrition Service at the UC Davis Veterinary Medical Teaching HospitalThe service provides nutritional consultations for the following:Pet owners who wish to consult a nutritionistOther VMTH services to provide nutritional recommendations and feeding plans for their patientsVeterinarians outside of UC DavisThe clinical scope of the Nutrition Support Service includes:Commercial diet recommendationsCritical care nutritionCustomized weight loss programsNutritional consultation for metabolic diseasesEvaluation and formulation of computer-generated, home-prepared therapeutic dietsAbout The ServiceClients within traveling distance to UC Davis can arrange a direct appointment with the Nutrition Service
Appointments are especially beneficial for patients in which traditional nutritional approaches have proven unsuccessful or for clients with a special interest in nutrition
The service also conducts remote consultations through primary veterinarians
Veterinarians can contact the Nutrition Service by telephone, and many of our services are provided via telephone, email, videoconference, or fax

Direct appointmentsIn order to strive for the most precise recommendations with positive outcomes, a minimal work-up of the patient’s health status must be performed prior to an appointment with the Nutrition Service

This generally includes a physical examination, complete blood count and biochemical panel including a T4, and may also include imaging, urinalysis, and biopsies depending upon the patient’s condition
Contact the service for more information

Remote consultationsUnfortunately, unless a relationship has been established between the client and the Nutrition Service clinicians with a direct appointment, advice regarding disease management for specific pets cannot be provided directly to clients
Consults must be initiated by the primary care veterinarian who has the most current knowledge of the patient
A summarized medical history and detailed diet history, in addition to recent laboratory results are usually required prior to the initiation of a consultation
Client communication for such cases is handled by the primary care veterinarian
Our Customized ApproachAll cases undergo extensive medical record review, as well as evaluation of the dietary history including treats and supplements

The process can be quite involved, as strategies and products are evaluated for both safety and efficacy in light of clinical experience, as well as through research including scientific literature review
This preliminary assessment is followed by quantitative computer analysis of data
This process ensures the development of a comprehensive and truly customized nutritional management plan

Frequently Asked Questions (pdf)The Nutrition Service Provides:Home-prepared recipe formulationsSpecialized computer software is used to design customized recipes that meet the needs of individual patients using common human foods
This process involves evaluation of the medical history of individual patients, as well as the application of knowledge, experience and a large amount of information from a variety of sources
Download "What will my recipe look like" (pdf) Client home-prepared recipe evaluationsRecipes are analyzed and adjusted to ensure that they are balanced and appropriate for the individual patient
Nutritional supplement evaluationsSupplements are reviewed for evidence of published data supporting safety and efficacy of the product for the species of interest and the intended use
Weight loss plansCustomized diet programs to achieve controlled weight loss are critical to minimize hunger and avoid muscle loss
Nutritional counselingFeeding strategies for disease prevention, management and/or treatment for specific patients are discussed with consulting veterinarians and during direct appointments
Critical care nutritional supportCustomized formulations and feeding guidelines for enteral support (tube feeding) as well as for parenteral (intravenous) administration are available
The Nutrition Service also provides patient monitoring guidelines to consulting veterinarians

Commercial food recommendationsThe Nutrition Service provides assistance in selecting appropriate commercially available food options for patients in various life stages and those with specific diseases
What is a Veterinary Nutritionist
The American College of Veterinary Internal Medicine now includes Nutrition as its sixth specialty (until 2021, and since 1988, there was a separate American College of Veterinary Nutrition)
The specialty comprises veterinarians who have undergone advanced clinical and research training in the field of nutrition
Many have a graduate degree in nutrition in addition to their veterinary medical degree
All have completed extensive residency training which involves intensive clinical, teaching, and research activities
Trainees are required to pass written examinations in order to obtain board certification
These specialists are uniquely trained in the nutritional management of both healthy animals and those with one or more diseases
Members of this specialty college add the suffix “Diplomate ACVIM (Nutrition)” and are Board Certified Veterinary Nutritionists®
The UC Davis School of Veterinary Medicine is fortunate to be supported by several boarded nutritionists and veterinarians training for the specialty

The large group of veterinarians enables the Nutrition Service to have unique programs such as a veterinary student rotation, an outside consulting service for practicing veterinarians worldwide, and an active receiving service for referred cases from general practitioners and specialists in other fields

veterinaryInsights.text: Your pet’s well-being is our top priority We provide comprehensive medical and surgical care for dogs, cats, birds, and exotic pets, utilizing advanced diagnostics, modern surgical suites, and cutting-edge technologies to treat even the most complex conditions. Emergencies pharmacy Referring Veterinarians About the small animal hospital UF Small Animal HOspital Emergencies Open for emergency patients 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Call (352) 392-2235 if you have an emergency. After 5 p.m. Monday through Friday, on weekends, and on holidays your call will be forwarded to the emergency clinician on duty or an ICU technician. Learn More UF Small Animal Hospital Specialty Services Our hospital offers a variety of veterinary specialty services staffed by board-certified specialists, residents, interns, and skilled veterinary technicians. With many specialists in one location, we provide advanced diagnostic and treatment options for cats, dogs, birds, exotics, and wildlife. All Services UF Small Animal Hospital Primary Care & Dentistry Primary Care and Dentistry provides well-pet care and advanced dog and cat dentistry, including routine cleanings, in a university setting with access to specialty services. Our doctors serve as a resource for Florida veterinarians on small animal dentistry advancements and offer interns and students the opportunity to become excellent general practice veterinarians. Learn More UF Small animal hospital Clinical Studies The University of Florida Small Animal Hospital and Large Animal Hospital offer clinical studies for dogs, cats, other small animals and large animals to determine efficacy and safety for future treatments, therapies, and diagnostic tools. All Clinical Studies UF Small Animal hospital Leading Referral Facility in Florida & Southeast We are committed to offering the best-possible treatment for your pet via a wide range of expertise in many specialties. veterinaryInsights.text: Your pet’s well-being is our top priority We provide comprehensive medical and surgical care for dogs, cats, birds, and exotic pets, utilizing advanced diagnostics, modern surgical suites, and cutting-edge technologies to treat even the most complex conditions. Emergencies pharmacy Referring Veterinarians About the small animal hospital UF Small Animal HOspital Emergencies Open for emergency patients 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Call (352) 392-2235 if you have an emergency. After 5 p.m. Monday through Friday, on weekends, and on holidays your call will be forwarded to the emergency clinician on duty or an ICU technician. Learn More UF Small Animal Hospital Specialty Services Our hospital offers a variety of veterinary specialty services staffed by board-certified specialists, residents, interns, and skilled veterinary technicians. With many specialists in one location, we provide advanced diagnostic and treatment options for cats, dogs, birds, exotics, and wildlife. All Services UF Small Animal Hospital Primary Care & Dentistry Primary Care and Dentistry provides well-pet care and advanced dog and cat dentistry, including routine cleanings, in a university setting with access to specialty services. Our doctors serve as a resource for Florida veterinarians on small animal dentistry advancements and offer interns and students the opportunity to become excellent general practice veterinarians. Learn More UF Small animal hospital Clinical Studies The University of Florida Small Animal Hospital and Large Animal Hospital offer clinical studies for dogs, cats, other small animals and large animals to determine efficacy and safety for future treatments, therapies, and diagnostic tools. All Clinical Studies UF Small Animal hospital Leading Referral Facility in Florida & Southeast We are committed to offering the best-possible treatment for your pet via a wide range of expertise in many specialties. veterinaryInsights.text:
Events & Courses
				
				
			
				WSAVA Partners with ESAVA for the First Kahun Congress & Expo in Cairo – 5–6 May 2026			
		
				
			The Egyptian Small Animal Veterinary Association (ESAVA), a proud WSAVA member association, will host its first Kahun Congress & Expo in Cairo, Egypt on 5–6 May 2026. WSAVA is delighted to support our Egyptian member association in this milestone event as an Official Education Partner.
		
					
		
		
			Read More »

veterinaryInsights.text:
Congress
				
				
			
				Bidding Now Open to Host WSAVA World Congress (2028–2031)			
		
				
			Bidding is now open to host one of the upcoming WSAVA World Congresses (2028–2031)!
Member associations are invited to submit an Expression of Interest to host this flagship global event and help bring world-class veterinary education and collaboration to their region.
		
					
		
		
			Read More »

Join AAHA
						
				
					
													Accredit Your Hospital
																			Animal hospitals around the world earn AAHA accreditation to strengthen their business, advance their team, and provide the best possible care to companion animals.
																		
															Get Started
													
											
					
													Join as a Veterinary Professional
																			Veterinary professionals spanning a spectrum of roles enjoy exclusive benefits and join a community of dedicated practitioners.
												
															Join as an Individual Member
